page.title: 05Ecology in Rawdon -1
page.content: The first year juniors looked at a strip of land from the top of Rawdon Billing,down through the fields to the dam,over the school playing fields, over Town street,across the Leeds Rd. and on down New York Lane.We studied the trees(mainly sycamore,beech,oak, rowan and silver birch),the plants (buttercups,daisies,red and white clover,cow parsley,a variety of grasses,broom and gorse)the birds (sparrow,starling,blackbird,thrush, blue tit,magpie,chaffinch,robin,black headed gull,carrion crow in winter and swifts,house martins and swallows in summer) Many domestic animals can be found in the area we studied,mainly cows,sheep and horses.Pigeons are also kept on the Biling.
